= Introduction =
a step by step guide which assumes that you've never compiled anything on your system, and that this system is Gutsy Gibbon.

==Installing gtk2-aqd==

  * Install gtk2-aqd (steps coming later)
    # {{{sudo apt-get install build-essential}}}
    # {{{apt-get source gtk+2.0}}}
    # Download the patch
{{{wget http://gnome2-globalmenu.googlecode.com/svn/branches/0.2.1/gtk2-aqd/gtkmenubar.patch}}}
    # Apply the patch (steps coming later)
    # ./configure --prefix=/usr
    # make
    # sudo make install


==Installing the applet itself==

  * Install libgtk2.0-dev, intltool,libwnck-dev, libpanelapplet-2.0, gdk-2.0 ( {{{sudo aptitude install libgtk2.0-dev intltool libwnck-dev libpanelapplet2-dev gdk-imlib11-dev}}}  in a terminal )

  * Download the tarball, extract it and open a terminal. using {{{cd}}} go to the newly extracted directory 

  * Configure the tarball ({{{./configure}}})

  * Install the program ({{{sudo make}}}, followed by {{{sudo aptitude install checkinstall}}} and then {{{sudo checkinstall}}})


  * We now have to add a bonobo server file where {{{APP_LOCATION}}} is {{{/usr/local/libexec}}})

  # Download it: {{{wget http://gnome2-globalmenu.googlecode.com/files/GNOME_GlobalMenuApplet.server}}}

  # Let's copy it in the right directory:  sudo cp GNOME_GlobalMenuApplet.server /usr/lib/bonobo/servers/GNOME_GlobalMenuApplet.server


  # Right-click on the panel and click add to the panel. Look for Global Menubar. Add it. And voila. It should work.
